# worldRight

**Instance Property**

The “right” (+X) direction vector relative to the node, expressed in world space.

## Declaration

```swift
var worldRight: SCNVector3 { get }
```

## Discussion

Reading this property is equivalent to reading the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/localRight] class property and using the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/convertVector(_:to:)] or [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode/convertVector(_:from:)] method to convert that vector from the node’s local coordinate space to the scene’s world coordinate space.

## Related Documentation

- **simdWorldRight**: The “right” (+X) direction vector relative to the node, expressed in world space.

## Calculating Node-Relative Transforms (SceneKit Types)

- **localRight**: The direction SceneKit treats as “right” in local space for all nodes.
- **localUp**: The direction SceneKit treats as “up” in local space for all nodes.
- **localFront**: The unit vector SceneKit treats as “forward” in local space for all nodes.
- **worldUp**: The “up” (+Y) direction vector relative to the node, expressed in world space.
- **worldFront**: The “forward” (-Z) direction vector relative to the node, expressed in world space.
